title.native: 銃皇無尽のファフニール

description:
In the "unlimited school battle action" story, the world was transformed by the sudden appearance of monsters known collectively as dragons. Before long, girls known as "D" were born with the dragons' powers. A boy named Yuu Mononobe is the world's only male "D," although his existence is kept secret. He is forced to enroll into Midgar, a school for "D" girls, where he see a female student Iris naked. Moreover, he is reunited with his long-separated little sister Mitsuki.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Female Harem

node.description: Kusakawa Keizou is a storyboarder and director working for [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs). During his early years at the studio he has worked under [Shinbou Akiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou) and has since then been also involved in several shows directed by Shinbou at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft). Kusakawa also took over the duties as director of the Lyrical Nanoha series from Shinbou after he left Seven Arcs, starting with its second season, Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Enatsu Yuki (江夏由結)__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, songwriter and series composer. She was previously an animator, and she currently works for Studio Live, while also being a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Enatsu Yuki (江夏由結)__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, songwriter and series composer. She was previously an animator, and she currently works for Studio Live, while also being a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/水野和則)

Freelancer with strong ties to [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/) at the time of his passing.

Passed away while sleeping at his desk at Pierrot.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabeshin_afro)__ __Shinichi Watanabe__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist for anime, while also being a voice actor. Shinichi is best known for his over-the-top adaption of Rikudo Koshi's [Excel Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/379/Heppoko-Jikken-Animation-Excel-Saga), in which he appears as the character Nabeshin. In addition to his appearance in Excel Saga and [Puni Puni Poemy](https://anilist.co/anime/564/Puni-PuniPoemii), his likeness has also appeared as NB in [Tenchi Muyo! GXP](https://anilist.co/anime/1133/Tenchi-Muyo-GXP), Inu-Afro in [Dotto Koni-Chan](https://anilist.co/anime/1684/Dotto-Konichan) and in small role in [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/Mahoromatic). He also does an unmistakable cameo of Nabeshin, which can be seen in [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/), although Shinichi had nothing to do with that project. In addition he made an appearance in the show [EyeShield 21](https://anilist.co/anime/15/Eyeshield-21). More recently he made an appearance in episode 32 of [Hayate no Gotoku](https://anilist.co/anime/2026/Hayate-no-Gotoku). Shinichi claims that the nickname Nabeshin (which is an obvious combination of "nabe" in Watanabe, and "shin" in Shinichi) came from God himself. (Not to be confused with the director [Watanabe Shinichirou](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe), which is most known for directing Cowboy Bebop)

Shinichi claims that the nickname Nabeshin (which is an obvious combination of "nabe" in Watanabe, and "shin" in Shinichi) came from God himself. (Not to be confused with the director [Watanabe Shinichirou](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe), which is most known for directing Cowboy Bebop)
